RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GIRLS PERFUME gave chase and raced close off the rail on the turn, dug in the final furlong and took the nod under the wire. ANOTHER FINE JUBA took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, contested the advantage at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. MISS INTENSITY steadied at the rail approaching the three eighths pole, started a bid nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and came along for third toward mid-stretch. YES TO LOVE gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail, eased out leaving the turn and showed little further. SOMESUGARNSPICE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. BEA'S LEGEND lost contact early.

ENTRY.NAME: Another Fine Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Girls Perfume
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,dug in lane,nod at wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DE'S CASTLE was bumped leaving the gate but tapered in and rated the early pace, was urged away at the rail on the turn then kept sharp in the stretch. WINDSOR'S STAR veered out and made contact with De's Castle leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path, dueled for second mid-stretch and held on. KING OF LUCK chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly while gaining on the runner-up. BOP ZAPPER gave chase while tapering in, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened stride later yards. JUST JUBA exchanged contact with In High Gear leaving the gate then gave chase outside, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and showed little in the lane. ROCKING TO HOME gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened. IN HIGH GEAR veered out leaving the gate and made contact with Just Juba then gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: King of Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,even finish,gaining on runner-up

ENTRY.NAME: In High Gear
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,chased,5p turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Just Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased outside,4& 5p turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: De's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,rated pace,urged away rail turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHAMELESS APPEAL gave chase outside and steadily improved in the four path on the turn, dug in from the head of the stretch and got up the final yards. AIR KENNEY took a quick lead and set a pressured pace off the rail, contested the edge through the turn and cleared COMO ESTAS inside the sixteenth pole, but was caught in the the final yards. The latter pressured the pace inside and contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the turn, remained a factor to mid-stretch but flattened stride later yards. ARYA CHARMING came away awkwardly then gave chase leaving the chute, entered the turn near the rail, angled out approaching the head of the lane and finished well while gaining on the top three. LAST OF BAD BOYS chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. CHASIN CHAPIN chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, was carried out nearing the head of the lane and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Como Estas
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close rail turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Air Kenney
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,set pressured pace,edge off rail turn,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Arya Charming
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,chased,rail into turn,angled out 1/8,gaining late

ENTRY.NAME: Shameless Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,improved 4p turn,dug in lane,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR pressured the pace and contested even terms two deep on the turn, cleared SK'S HEART mid-stretch and widened through later yards. The latter set a pressured pace and contested even terms at the rail on the turn, but dropped back toward mid-stretch and flattened stride. EBONY QUEEN veered out leaving the gate and made contact with Everydayisagift then engaged in close chase, steadied from between horses past the three eighths pole, bore out through the turn but regained stride leaving the turn and came along for third mid-stretch. PRINCESS MIA ROSE pressured the pace inside, dropped back approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened later yards. EVERYDAYISAGIFT was squeezed at the break and settled into stride early, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the turn but showed little more. OUR GOLDEN COLLEEN ducked in leaving the gate and made contact with Everydayisagift then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. TODAYISMYDAY gave chase inside, steadied at the rail approaching the quarter pole and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Fiddlershotpleasur
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,cleared 1/16,widened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE APRIL 27, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 , if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET CASTLE rated off the early pace inside, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead two deep toward the head of the lane, dueled clear past the eighth pole and held well under steady handing. SHES SO SPEIGHTSY saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, steadily improved in the three path on the far turn and finished well to take second later yards. EXPRESS LADY raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and finished evenly to take third the final yards. EXTRA CRUNCHY stalked off the rail on the first turn, closed to the lead three wide at the seven sixteenths pole, dueled clear into the far turn but was met approaching the eighth pole and weakened the final sixteenth. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY stalked from the three path the first turn, dueled at even terms leaving the half mile pole but was met toward the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. BONNIE BLUETOOTH saved ground off the pace, steadied off the inside flank of Flava's Dream into the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE moved to the inside and rated the early pace, was met past the half mile pole and faded through the backstretch. FLAVA'S DREAM suffered a fatal injury into the first turn and had to be euthanized on the track. The Stewards reviewed the incident into the first turn before declaring this race official.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stable, LLC. & Ronney Brown

ENTRY.NAME: Shes So Speightsy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,3p far turn,finished well,up 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MITOLE CANDY stalked from the three path the first turn, started a bid toward the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, angled out leaving the turn, was bumped off stride at the eighth pole but never lost a beat and took the lead mid-stretch and edged out JUNE BELLE through the final sixteenth. The latter came away awkwardly and raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. PETTY PERFECT stalked off the rail the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn, dueled between horses through the upper stretch and flattened later yards. MALIBU YEARS was roughed from a boxed in situation passing the five eighths pole, gave chase from the nine sixteenths and rounded the far turn near the rail, angled outward and made sharp contact with Mitole Candy at the eighth pole, was roughed behind a wall of horses in the upper stretch but came back to finish evenly. LIGHTNIN QUEEN rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, but was met nearing mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. ROMAN CANDLE raced two deep on the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and weakened off the rail on the far turn. QUINN ELIA raced off the pace inside, faded past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, angled to the outside leaving the turn and showed no more. SHOTGUN MARGARET bobbled at the break and never factored. FLAMME FATALE raced in the five path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. BEVERLY'SACTINUP raced well back. The Stewards conducted an inquiry to review the incident into the first turn and past the eighth pole before declaring this race official.

ENTRY.NAME: Quinn Elia
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,faded past 7/16,rail far turn,outside 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: June Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

ENTRY.NAME: Petty Perfect
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,challenged 7/16,close 2d turn,flattened late yds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO LOVE FOR JUBA stalked off the rail then challenged approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead two deep at the five sixteenths and was kept alert through the lane. GRUMPY'S BUDDY raced in the four path the first turn, the three path on the second turn and gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and dueled to a clear second inside the sixteenth pole. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY raced in the three path early, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, steadily progressed at the rail on the far turn and came along to take third the final strides. STROLLINGINTHEWIND settled off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and flattened the final sixteenth. ROAD SLEW raced off the rail early and came through the second turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. NOCASHREFUNDS rated a short lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, was met at the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. JACKSON MAN saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened past the three eighths.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Slew
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,4p 2nd turn,chased 7/16,weakened into far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIEUTENANT BROWN came away awkwardly and was bumped leaving the gate, saved ground well back from early contention, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, angled out through the far turn and entered the stretch six wide, dueled for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. COMEONTURNMELOOSE raced well off the pace about the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the half mile pole and entered the far turn in the three path, angled five wide leaving the turn but relented in the duel through the stretch. LASTWALKTOFREEDOM tapered in and rated a slim lead inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole and dueled at mostly even terms from that point, cleared Monkey Wrench at the quarter pole but was met passing the eighth pole and flattened the final sixteenth. ASTRAYAL saved ground, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SCARE DEM saved ground well off the pace the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the six and seven paths and passed some rivals. JOOBY DOOBY DOO rated off the pace inside on the opening turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced four wide on the far turn, then weakened mid-stretch. MONKEY WRENCH stalked three wide and moved to even terms at the nine sixteenths pole, was checked off the heels of Burr Hill Bullet at the seven sixteenths pole, quickly regained stride to resume the chase and raced close through the far turn, left the turn in tight between horses and flattened stride. SUGAR LIPS exchanged contact with Lieutenant Brown leaving the gate and raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. ON A WHIM stalked two deep while between horses in the front stretch but dropped back at the nine sixteenths pole and faded past the three eighths. BURR HILL BULLET stumbled losing his rider leaving the gate.

ENTRY.NAME: Astrayal
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Lips
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,chased 1/2,3p far turn,angled 5wd,relented lane
